courses.description: The African American experience, focusing on African and African American culture, the slave trade, slavery and emancipation in the Americas, social structure, and civil rights. Individual and Society, and US Society course.
A survey of African American political and cultural activism from the Black Convention Movement of the 1830's to contemporary times. Same as POLS 112. Individual and Society, and US Society course.

courses.course_title: Race, Place, and Schooling: African Americans and Education
courses.description: Examination of the social, political, cultural and economic factors shaping African American's educational experiences in the United States historically and currently. Same as EDPS 104. Individual and Society, and US Society course.

courses.course_title: African Americans in Film, 1900 - Present: Images, Individuals and Ideas on Screen
courses.description: Examination of the history of African Americans in film from Oscar Micheaux to Spike Lee and Julie Dash; the careers of Black filmmakers, actors, images, themes and ideas in films by and about people of African descent in the 20th century. Same as COMM 105. Creative Arts, and US Society course.
Comprehensive survey, 1760-1910, from earliest folk roots to formal literary tradition. Same as ENGL 118. Creative Arts, and Individual and Society course.

courses.course_title: Introduction to African American Literature Since 1910
courses.description: Comprehensive survey of African American literature from 1910 to the present. Same as ENGL 119. Creative Arts, and US Society course.

Introduction to the significance of religion and religious institutions in African American history. Examination of Christian and non-Christian traditions, mainstream and sectarian. Past, and US Society course.
Introduction to history and historical methods through the study of African history. Same as HIST 141. Past, and World Cultures course.

courses.course_title: African and Caribbean Francophone Literature in Translation
courses.description: An introduction to the Francophone literature of Africa and the Caribbean and to its historical and cultural contexts. Same as FR 191. Creative Arts, and World Cultures course.

courses.course_title: History of Race Relations in America
courses.description: An examination of American racial thought and racial discrimination to determine how the content and function of both have changed over time. Same as HIST 251, and LALS 251.
